description: From Latin dēprecātus, past participle of deprecari (“to pray against (a present or impending evil), pray for, intercede for (that which is in danger), rarely imprecate”), from de (“off”) + precari (“to pray”).

adjectives.description: deprecated (comparative more deprecated, superlative most deprecated)

entries.meaning: (computing) Said of a function or feature planned to be phased out, but still available for use.
examples: Synonyms: on its way out, obsolescent; see also Thesaurus:obsolete

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of deprecate
